name: Grape
description: Grapes are fruits used to produce wine and known for their sweet and juicy flavor.
careInstructions: Grapevines require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-drained soil. They need support for their climbing habit.
pruningNeeds: Prune in late winter or early spring

name: Duckweed
description: Duckweed is a small, free-floating aquatic plant that reproduces rapidly and forms dense mats on the water's surface.
careInstructions: Duckweed requires still or slow-moving freshwater with plenty of sunlight. It is an essential food source for various aquatic organisms.
specialFeatures: Provides food and shelter for aquatic life

name: Apple
description: Apples are popular fruits known for their sweet and crunchy taste.
careInstructions: Apple trees require full sunlight, regular watering, well-drained soil, and pruning in late winter. They are susceptible to pests like apple maggots and diseases like apple scab.
winterHardiness: Some varieties may require protection in colder regions

name: Thyme
description: Thyme is a small perennial herb with fragrant leaves used as a culinary seasoning.
careInstructions: Thyme prefers full sunlight and well-drained soil. It is drought-tolerant and doesn't require much water.

name: Japanese Painted Fern
description: Japanese Painted Ferns are deciduous ferns with unique silver-gray fronds and purple veins, creating a striking and colorful foliage display.
careInstructions: Japanese Painted Ferns thrive in partial to full shade and well-draining, moist soil. They require regular watering to keep the soil consistently moist.

name: Hops
description: Hops are climbing vines widely cultivated for their use in beer production as a flavoring and stability agent.
careInstructions: Hops prefer full sunlight, rich and well-draining soil, and regular watering. They require support structures for climbing.
pruningNeeds: Prune in spring to remove old growth

name: Water Lily
description: Water lilies are aquatic plants known for their beautiful floating leaves and fragrant flowers that bloom on the water's surface.
careInstructions: Water lilies require still or slow-moving freshwater with plenty of sunlight. They are best planted in pots or containers submerged in the water.
pruningNeeds: Remove old and yellow leaves regularly
winterHardiness: May require protection in colder regions

name: Bird's Nest Fern
description: Bird's Nest Ferns are tropical ferns known for their wide, nest-like appearance and glossy green fronds.
careInstructions: Bird's Nest Ferns prefer bright, indirect light and high humidity. Keep the soil evenly moist but not waterlogged.

name: Tulip
description: Tulips are herbaceous perennial plants known for their cup-shaped, vibrant-colored flowers.
careInstructions: Tulips require full sunlight, well-drained soil, and moderate watering. Plant the bulbs in the fall for spring blooms.

name: Basil
description: Basil is a fragrant herb widely used in culinary dishes and has various medicinal properties.
careInstructions: Basil prefers full sunlight and well-draining soil. Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged. Pinch off flowers to encourage leaf growth.
pruningNeeds: Pinch off flowers to encourage leaf growth
winterHardiness: Not cold-tolerant, grown as an annual in colder regions

name: Daisy
description: Daisies are small, herbaceous perennial plants with white or pinkish flowers and a yellow center.
careInstructions: Daisies prefer full sunlight and well-drained soil. They require regular watering, especially during dry spells.

name: Tomato
description: Tomatoes are popular fruiting vegetables known for their juicy and versatile culinary uses.
careInstructions: Tomatoes require full sunlight, regular watering, well-drained soil, and support for their growth. They are susceptible to diseases like blight and pests like aphids.

name: Haworthia
description: Haworthia is a diverse genus of small succulent plants known for their rosette-forming growth habit and distinctive patterns on their leaves.
careInstructions: Haworthias prefer bright but indirect sunlight and well-draining soil. Water sparingly as they are adapted to arid conditions.

name: Hens and Chicks
description: Hens and Chicks, also known as Houseleeks, are mat-forming succulents with rosettes that produce numerous 'chick' offsets.
careInstructions: Hens and Chicks prefer full sunlight and well-draining soil. They are extremely drought-tolerant and should be watered sparingly.
pruningNeeds: Remove spent rosettes and offset 'chicks' as needed

name: Wisteria
description: Wisterias are stunning climbing vines adored for their cascading clusters of fragrant and colorful flowers.
careInstructions: Wisterias require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-draining soil. They need sturdy support structures for climbing and pruning to control growth.
winterHardiness: May require protection in colder regions

name: Forsythia
description: Forsythia is a deciduous shrub known for its early-blooming bright yellow flowers.
careInstructions: Forsythias prefer full sunlight, well-drained soil, and moderate watering. Pruning should be done after flowering to promote new growth and maintain shape.

name: Azalea
description: Azaleas are deciduous or evergreen shrubs with colorful flowers and are a popular choice in gardens and landscapes.
careInstructions: Azaleas prefer partial shade to full sunlight, well-drained, acidic soil, and regular watering. Mulching helps retain moisture and maintain soil acidity.

name: Maidenhair Fern
description: Maidenhair ferns are delicate and lacy ferns known for their distinctive fan-shaped fronds and elegant appearance.
careInstructions: Maidenhair ferns prefer partial shade, high humidity, and well-draining soil. They need regular watering, but avoid waterlogging the soil.

name: Water Sprite
description: Water sprite is a popular aquarium plant with delicate, feathery leaves that can grow partially or fully submerged.
careInstructions: Water sprite requires a well-lit aquarium with stable water conditions. It benefits from the addition of nutrients and CO2.
pruningNeeds: Trim to control growth and remove dead leaves

name: Rose
description: Roses are woody perennial flowering plants known for their beautiful and fragrant blooms.
careInstructions: Roses require full sunlight, regular watering, well-drained soil, and pruning in early spring. They are susceptible to common rose diseases like blackspot and powdery mildew.
winterHardiness: Some varieties may require protection in colder regions

name: Sunflower
description: Sunflowers are tall, annual flowering plants known for their large, vibrant yellow flower heads.
careInstructions: Sunflowers require full sunlight and well-drained soil. They are drought-tolerant but need regular watering during dry periods.

name: Bell Pepper
description: Bell peppers are colorful and sweet-tasting fruits often used in various culinary dishes.
careInstructions: Bell peppers require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-drained soil. They are susceptible to pests like aphids and diseases like bacterial spot.

name: Ginkgo
description: Ginkgos are unique and ancient trees with distinctive fan-shaped leaves that turn vibrant yellow in the fall.
careInstructions: Ginkgos prefer full sunlight or partial shade and can tolerate a wide range of soil types. They are drought-tolerant and low-maintenance trees.

name: Lilac
description: Lilac is a deciduous shrub highly valued for its stunning and fragrant flower clusters.
careInstructions: Lilacs prefer full sunlight, well-drained soil, and moderate watering. They require minimal pruning, and deadheading spent blooms can promote more flowers.

name: Boston Fern
description: Boston ferns are popular houseplants appreciated for their arching fronds and lush green foliage, making them an excellent addition to indoor spaces.
careInstructions: Boston ferns prefer bright, indirect light and high humidity. Keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.

name: Mango
description: Mangoes are tropical fruits known for their juicy and sweet taste.
careInstructions: Mango trees require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-drained soil. They prefer warm temperatures and high humidity.
pruningNeeds: Prune to remove dead or diseased branches

name: Lemon Balm
description: Lemon Balm is a lemon-scented herb used in teas and culinary dishes, known for its calming effects.
careInstructions: Lemon Balm thrives in partial shade to full sunlight and well-drained soil. Keep the soil consistently moist.

name: Boxwood
description: Boxwood is a popular evergreen shrub known for its dense foliage and versatility in landscaping.
careInstructions: Boxwoods prefer partial shade to full sunlight, well-drained soil, and regular watering. They are generally low-maintenance and can be pruned to maintain shape and size.

name: Echeveria
description: Echeveria is a popular genus of succulent plants with rosette-shaped, fleshy leaves and striking colors.
careInstructions: Echeverias prefer bright sunlight, well-draining soil, and infrequent watering. They are drought-tolerant but should not be overwatered to prevent root rot.

name: Staghorn Fern
description: Staghorn ferns are epiphytic ferns that grow on trees or rocks, known for their unique antler-like fronds and distinctive appearance.
careInstructions: Staghorn ferns prefer bright, indirect light and high humidity. They are epiphytic and typically grow on a mounting board or in a hanging basket with a well-draining substrate.

name: Passionflower
description: Passionflowers are beautiful and exotic climbing vines known for their intricate and colorful flowers.
careInstructions: Passionflowers thrive in full sunlight, require regular watering, and well-draining soil. They are vigorous growers and may need support for climbing.
pruningNeeds: Prune to shape and control growth
winterHardiness: May require protection in colder regions

name: Java Fern
description: Java ferns are popular aquatic plants in aquariums, known for their unique and attractive frilly leaves.
careInstructions: Java ferns prefer to be attached to driftwood or rocks in aquariums. They thrive in low to moderate light conditions.
pruningNeeds: Remove dead or decaying leaves regularly

name: Magnolia
description: Magnolias are elegant trees known for their large, fragrant flowers and glossy green leaves.
careInstructions: Magnolias prefer full sunlight or partial shade, well-drained soil, and regular watering. Prune them after flowering to shape the tree and remove dead branches.
winterHardiness: Winter protection needed in colder regions

name: Crape Myrtle
description: Crape Myrtles are small to medium-sized trees appreciated for their vibrant, long-lasting flowers and attractive bark.
careInstructions: Plant Crape Myrtles in full sunlight, use well-drained soil, and provide regular watering during dry periods. Prune them in late winter or early spring to promote flowering.
pruningNeeds: Prune in late winter or early spring
winterHardiness: Some varieties may need winter protection

name: Carrot
description: Carrots are root vegetables known for their sweet, crunchy, and vibrant orange-colored roots.
careInstructions: Carrots require full sunlight, regular watering, loose and well-drained soil to avoid root deformation. They are generally pest-resistant but can be affected by carrot rust flies.

name: Dogwood
description: Dogwoods are elegant trees or shrubs known for their showy flowers and colorful berries.
careInstructions: Plant Dogwoods in partial shade to full sunlight and provide regular watering. Prune them in late winter to remove dead wood and shape the tree.

name: Cucumber
description: Cucumbers are refreshing and hydrating vegetables commonly used in salads and pickles.
careInstructions: Cucumbers require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-drained soil. They are susceptible to pests like cucumber beetles and diseases like powdery mildew.

name: Morning Glory
description: Morning glories are beautiful and fast-growing climbing vines with showy trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the morning.
careInstructions: Morning glories thrive in full sunlight, prefer well-drained soil, and require moderate watering. Provide support structures for climbing.

name: Spinach
description: Spinach is a leafy green vegetable known for its nutritional value and versatility in cooking.
careInstructions: Spinach prefers cool weather and partial shade. It requires consistent watering and fertile, well-draining soil. It can be prone to pests like leaf miners.

name: Peppermint
description: Peppermint is a perennial herb known for its refreshing aroma and cooling taste.
careInstructions: Peppermint thrives in partial shade and requires consistently moist soil. It spreads vigorously, so it's best to plant it in containers to prevent it from taking over the garden.
winterHardiness: May require protection in colder regions

name: Orange
description: Oranges are citrus fruits known for their juicy and tangy flavor.
careInstructions: Orange trees require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-drained soil. They are susceptible to pests like citrus leafminer and diseases like citrus greening.
pruningNeeds: Prune to shape and remove dead wood

name: Lily
description: Lilies are tall, elegant flowering plants with large, showy blooms and a delightful fragrance.
careInstructions: Lilies prefer full sunlight, well-drained soil, and regular watering. Mulching around the plants can help retain moisture.
pruningNeeds: Remove spent flowers and yellowing leaves
winterHardiness: Some varieties may require protection in colder regions

name: Jade Plant
description: The Jade Plant is a popular succulent with thick, glossy, green leaves and a tree-like growth habit.
careInstructions: Jade Plants prefer bright light but can tolerate some shade. Allow the soil to dry between waterings, as they are susceptible to root rot.
pruningNeeds: Prune to shape and remove dead growth

name: Japanese Maple
description: Japanese Maples are stunning small trees appreciated for their delicate, colorful leaves and graceful shape.
careInstructions: Plant Japanese Maples in a location with partial shade, well-drained soil, and protect them from strong winds. They require regular watering and pruning to maintain their shape.

name: Honeysuckle
description: Honeysuckles are delightful climbing vines famous for their sweetly scented, tubular flowers that attract hummingbirds and butterflies.
careInstructions: Honeysuckles thrive in full sunlight, prefer well-drained soil, and require regular watering. Provide sturdy support for climbing and prune to maintain shape.
winterHardiness: May require protection in colder regions

name: Chamomile
description: Chamomile is a small, daisy-like herb known for its calming properties and apple-like fragrance.
careInstructions: Chamomile prefers full sunlight but can tolerate light shade. It requires well-draining soil and moderate watering.
winterHardiness: May require protection in colder regions

name: Banana
description: Bananas are tropical fruits known for their sweet and creamy flesh.
careInstructions: Banana plants require full sunlight, regular watering, and well-drained soil. They prefer warm temperatures and high humidity.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Aloe vera is a well-known succulent with thick, fleshy leaves that contain a gel-like substance with various medicinal properties.
careInstructions: Aloe vera thrives in bright sunlight and well-drained soil. Allow the soil to dry out between waterings. It is highly drought-tolerant.

name: Hydrangea
description: Hydrangea is a deciduous shrub known for its large, showy flower clusters that can change color based on soil pH.
careInstructions: Hydrangeas prefer partial shade to full sunlight, well-drained soil, and regular watering. Pruning should be done after flowering to remove dead wood.

name: Water Hyacinth
description: Water hyacinths are free-floating aquatic plants with vibrant purple flowers and glossy green leaves that float on the water surface.
careInstructions: Water hyacinths thrive in warm freshwater with full sunlight. They are excellent at absorbing excess nutrients from the water.
pruningNeeds: Remove dead or decaying leaves regularly
